intro: Aster azureus var. scabrior, commonly known as the rough blue aster, is a perennial herb native to the northeastern United States. It features blue to violet ray florets and yellow disk florets, typical of the Asteraceae family. The plant has rough, hairy stems and leaves with a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its showy flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
